page.title: 07ETTRICK VALLEY DIALECT.
page.content: Any visitors to Ettrick Valley probably wouldn't understand the locals when they spoke because they have a language of their own. If a shepherd says,"Come bye,"to his dog he means it to go round the sheep to the left,"Awa tae me,"means to go round to the right."Bide there,"means stay there and,"Awa back" means go back. A shepherd wouldn't say,"I need a shelter because my sheep are quite frightened from this storm,"they would say,"Ah need a bield cos ma sheep ur gey feart fae this storm." Somebody in Ettrick wouldn't say, "Get this mouse out of my house,"they would say,"Git this moose oot o ma hoose!"
